page.title: 09Southwick Estate
page.content: The estate is managed by{'The {Southwick and Roache Court Estate {Company'.}The estate is owned by Mrs. E.S.Borthwick-Norton. Her family bought the estate from the Earl of Southampton in{l539,}after the dissolution of the monasteries by Henry VIII. The estate is approx. 7,7OO acres, of which l,35O acres are woodland. The land is used for livestock, arable farming and forestry. There is no hunting on the estate, but there is shooting on the farms. The only fishing of note is at Dryad, which was purchased by the MOD in l947 for Â£4O,OOO. The Portsdown Hill forts were built on land purchased from the estate in l85O.
